data.title: Richmond County Clerk New York
data.text:
Created by the Constitution and Laws of the State of New York, the Office of the Richmond County Clerk(ORCC) is Staten Island's oldest governmental institution.

Founded in 1683, the ORCC is a Constitutional Office and diversified government service organization with four core business segments:

As Chief Recording Officer, we provide a myriad of public services and serve as the official records repository for Richmond County-recording and maintaining millions of vital legal documents and public records relating to business, court and real property matters as well as numerous miscellaneous filings. We are also responsible for collecting all associated fees and taxes and serve as a revenue collection agency for the City and State of New York.

This website will be undergoing a complete overhaul in an effort to better serve the needs of the communities of Staten Island and beyond. In the meantime, you may continue to interface with our office by clicking the appropriate subject matter listed on this page.

Thank you for visiting us!

Hon. Stephen J. Fiala

Richmond County Clerk and Commissioner of Jurors
